properties.areaDesc: Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:45AM MST until January 16 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring.
Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. For the Wind
Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills as
low as 40 below zero.

* WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front and Southern Rocky
Mountain Front.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM MST
Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY
